name: imitationcrab
text: AWK-WAAAARD!

name: clever-nickname
text: I think everyone's been here.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: what, riding in a serial killer's van, next in line? oh necessarily.

name: mockereo
text:
wearing a bee costume that makes it impossible to move your arms? obviously.

I mean what's the point of being in a serial killer's van if you aren't dressed as a bipedal bee.

name: rosie
text: God, this arc made me so hella nervous. I was gonna be pissed if something bad happened to Philipe.

name: tommycrashwreck
text: Yeah, me too. I was really surprised at the time, since I'd only been reading for a couple months, and also it was the first (last? last.) time a webcomic made me feel any attachment to its comics. I'd like for this comment to be funny, but honestly, I'm just in awe that Achewood can be even half what it is, sort of like Ted Leo. Simple components, the same ideas a bunch of times over, but it's always fuckin' terrific.

name: slab64
text: Mega-chub for Ted Leo fandom.

name: deancain29
text: guess who just got STAAAARED-ATTTT !

name: patkun
text: I can imagine getting kidnapped by a known muderer and sex offender being many things, but awkward has never really been one of the...until now.

name: achilleselbow
text: Do we really know he's a sex offender yet? Remember, those children were clothed and such.

name: breadcrab
text: Yes, but he had on a tank top, tube socks, and NOTHING ELSE.

name: laserblade
text: The police said "known sex offender". http://achewood.com/index.php?date=07092004

name: mattfish
text: man that could just mean he peed in an alley too many times (between murders)

name: 1000hz
text: And here is where the copyright and credit move from in between the panels to up at the top.

name: cdl146
text: Never even really noticed that before.

name: philosophe
text: best silent strip

name: someone3
text: if you notice it isn't nice pete that is being odd here. phillipe is staring at him.

name: jesler729
text: Well the man just kidnapped him. Even little inoccent Phillipe knows something is up.

name: _cheesekayke
text: Ohhh! Philippe's face in panels 4 and 6 makes me want to cry!

name: wae
text:
Chris Onstad stole the idea for this strip from my Junior Prom.

She wore the bee suit, I drove the van.

name: molesticide
text: what happened when you got to the ice cream parlor?

name: cousinted
text: Things started to get weird

name: gormster
text: Eyes on the road, Pete.

name: songbirdspectre
text: So funny. I love the alt-text.

name: yossarian
text: A comment left by yossarian was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mercuri0us, king_of_pwns, aHatOfPig)

name: farqussus
text: Nice Pete knows what is to come, and he doesn't like it, but that doesn't mean it isn't going to happen.

name: spinynorman
text: Much like The Box That The Children Will Die In, these things aren't about killing. They just happen sometimes.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Nice Pete doesn't know what is to come, and that is what bothers him. He likes the little otter in the bee costume. He doesn't want a bad thing to happen to the little otter.
But he cannot predict what Destiny will demand.

Awesomest noir silent strip.

name: bixschmix
text: OH MY GOD SOMEONE'S GOING TO DIE

name: charchar
text: Pete is turned off by his prey's blatant wide-eyed stare... It is just like a first date.

name: drago25
text: Brilliant strip, def needs to be closer to a 5 for how much it conveys without words and the palpable tension.

name: ananke
text: Why does Nice Pete's van look like the Mystery Machine pre-painted?

name: ananke
text:
"Sunshine, lollipops and rainbows,
Everything that's wonderful is what I feel when we're together..."

name: niraj
text: I just noticed that the wipers don't go off at any point during this comic. Just an observation :-/

name: poodlelucy
text: if you didn't know the outcome, wouldn't you say that pete in panel 8 is regretting the creepy act he feels compelled to do? *shudder*

name: hendetta
text:
One time my uncle was walking through the woods. Another man started walking with him.

My uncle looked at the man, and the man looked at my uncle. That man was afraid of my uncle, and my uncle was afraid of that man.

But they kept walking and came to a darker part of the woods. My uncle looked at the man, and the man looked at my uncle. That man was VERY afraid of my uncle and my uncle was VERY afraid of that man.

But still they kept walking until they could hardly see anything. My uncle looked at the man, and the man looked at my uncle. The man was TERRIBLY afraid of my uncle, and my uncle was TERRIBLY afraid of that man.

*NOW SCREAM!*

This is the story that this strip reminded me of.

name: carlyle
text:
After the story about the screaming the conversation really went downhill.

And I bet Phillippe is really wishing he was more talky now.
